info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:59PM EST until January 12 at 8:56AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Blacksburg VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke River At Roanoke affecting Roanoke, City of Salem and City of Roanoke independent cities. Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Halifax and Charlotte Counties. For the Roanoke River...including for Roanoke and for Randolph... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Water is several feet deep on portions of river road and black walnut road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 26.3 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
